result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick William Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as cognitive intervention. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must write a letter of apology to DP and deliver it to agent.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 09-16-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $1,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Bond to be transferred from case 14CM2411  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
